018package org.tquadrat.foundation.value.api;
019
020import static java.math.RoundingMode.HALF_EVEN;
021import static java.util.FormattableFlags.LEFT_JUSTIFY;
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNotEmptyArgument;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
027import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.padRight;
028
029import java.io.Serializable;
030import java.lang.reflect.Constructor;
031import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
032import java.math.BigDecimal;
033import java.math.MathContext;
034import java.util.Formattable;
035import java.util.Formatter;
036import java.util.IllegalFormatException;
037import java.util.Locale;
038
039import org.apiguardian.api.API;
040import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
041import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.MountPoint;
042import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.UnexpectedExceptionError;
043
044/**
045 *  The definition for a value with a dimension. <br>
046 *  <br>Although the unit for the dimension may be changed, instances of
047 *  classes implementing this interface can be assumed to be immutable as the
048 *  <i>value</i> remains always the same. So at least the results of the
049 *  methods
050 *  {@link #equals(Object)},
051 *  {@link #hashCode()},
052 *  and
053 *  {@link #compareTo(DimensionedValue)}
054 *  will remain always the same
055 *  (while the results from
056 *  {@link #toString()}
057 *  may differ after a call to
058 *  {@link #setUnit(Dimension)}).<br>
059 *  <br>All concrete (non-abstract) implementations of this interface should be
060 *  {@code final}.
061 *
062 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
063 *  @version $Id: DimensionedValue.java 989 2022-01-13 19:09:58Z tquadrat $
064 *  @since 0.1.0
065 *
066 *  @param  <D> The dimension.
067 *
068 *  @UMLGraph.link
069 */
070@SuppressWarnings( "ClassWithTooManyMethods" )
071@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: DimensionedValue.java 989 2022-01-13 19:09:58Z tquadrat $" )
072@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
073public interface DimensionedValue<D extends Dimension> extends Cloneable, Comparable<DimensionedValue<D>>, Formattable, Serializable
074{
075        /*-----------*\
076    ====** Constants **========================================================
077        \*-----------*/
078    /**
079     *  The
080     *  {@link MathContext}
081     *  that is used for all the operations with dimensioned values.
082     */
083    public static final MathContext MATH_CONTEXT = new MathContext( 128, HALF_EVEN );
084
085        /*---------*\
086    ====** Methods **==========================================================
087        \*---------*/
088    /**
089     *  Returns the base unit of the dimension for the value.
090     *
091     *  @return The base unit.
092     */
093    public default D baseUnit()
094    {
095        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
096        final var retValue = (D) getUnit().baseUnit();
097
098        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
099        return retValue;
100    }   //  baseUnit()
101
102    /**
103     *  <p>{@summary Returns the base value (this value, converted to the base
104      *  unit).}</p>
105     *  <p>According to the result, this is the same as calling</p>
106     *  <pre><code>convert( baseUnit() );</code></pre>.
107     *
108     *  @return The numerical value as for the base unit.
109     *
110     *  @see #convert(Dimension)
111     */
112    public BigDecimal baseValue();
113
114    /**
115     *  Creates a new copy of this value.
116     *
117     *  @return The copy.
118     *
119     *  @see Object#clone()
120     */
121    public DimensionedValue<D> clone();
122
123    /**
124     *  {@inheritDoc}
125     *  <p>The comparison is made based on the
126     *  {@link #baseValue()}.</p>
127     */
128    @Override
129    public default int compareTo( final DimensionedValue<D> other )
130    {
131        final var retValue = Integer.signum( baseValue().compareTo( requireNonNullArgument( other, "other" ).baseValue() ) );
132
133        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
134        return retValue;
135    }   //  compareTo()
136
137    /**
138     *  Converts this value to the given unit and returns the numerical value.
139     *
140     *  @param  unit    The unit.
141     *  @return The numerical value of this instance, based on the provided
142     *      unit.
143     *
144     *  @see #baseValue()
145     */
146    public default BigDecimal convert( final D unit )
147    {
148        final var conversion = requireNonNullArgument( unit, "unit" ).fromBase();
149        final var retValue = conversion.apply( baseValue() ).stripTrailingZeros();
150
151        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
152        return retValue;
153    }   //  convert()
154
155    /**
156     *  Creates a new copy of this value.
157     *
158     *  @return The copy.
159     *
160     *  @see Object#clone()
161     */
162    public DimensionedValue<D> copy();
163
164    /**
165     *  Creates a new copy of this value.
166     *
167     *  @param  unit    The unit for the new copy.
168     *  @return The copy.
169     *
170     *  @see Object#clone()
171     */
172    public DimensionedValue<D> copy( final D unit );
173
174    /**
175     *  Divides the value by a dimension-less value and returns the result
176     *  without changing this instance.
177     *
178     *  @param  divisor The divisor.
179     *  @return The new value.
180     */
181    public default DimensionedValue<D> divide( final BigDecimal divisor )
182    {
183        final var retValue = newInstance( baseUnit(), baseValue().divide( requireNonNullArgument( divisor, "divisor" ), MATH_CONTEXT ) );
184        retValue.setUnit( getUnit() );
185
186        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
187        return retValue;
188    }   //  divide()
189
190    /**
191     *  Divides the value by a dimension-less value and returns the result
192     *  without changing this instance.
193     *
194     *  @param  divisor The divisor.
195     *  @return The new value.
196     */
197    public default DimensionedValue<D> divide( final Number divisor )
198    {
199        final var retValue = divide( new BigDecimal( requireNonNullArgument( divisor, "divisor" ).toString() ) );
200        retValue.setUnit( getUnit() );
201
202        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
203        return retValue;
204    }   //  divide()
205
206    /**
207     *  Divides the value by a dimension-less value and returns the result
208     *  without changing this instance.
209     *
210     *  @param  divisor The divisor; it must be possible to parse the given
211     *      String into a
212     *      {@link BigDecimal}.
213     *  @return The new value.
214     *  @throws NumberFormatException   The provided value cannot be converted
215     *      into a {@code BigDecimal}.
216     *
217     *  @see BigDecimal#BigDecimal(String)
218     */
219    public default DimensionedValue<D> divide( final String divisor )
220    {
221        final var retValue = divide( new BigDecimal( requireNonNullArgument( divisor, "divisor" ) ) );
222
223        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
224        return retValue;
225    }   //  divide()
226
227    /**
228     *  {@inheritDoc}
229     *  <p>Two instances of a class implementing this interface are equals if
230     *  they are of the <i>same</i> class and if their values, converted to the
231     *  base dimension, are equals.</p>
232     *
233     *  @param  o   The other value.
234     *  @return {@code true} if they are equal, {@code false} if not.
235     *
236     *  @see Object#equals(Object)
237     *  @see Dimension#baseUnit()
238     */
239    @Override
240    public boolean equals( final Object o );
241
242    /**
243     *  {@inheritDoc}
244     *  <p>The precision is applied to the numerical part only. The width
245     *  includes the
246     *  {@linkplain Dimension#unitSymbol() unit symbol},
247     *  too.</p>
248     *
249     *  @note In case the {@code formatter} argument is {@code null}, this
250     *      method throws a {@code NullPointerException} and <i>not</i> the
251     *      usual {@code NullArgumentException}, because this method is usually
252     *      called by instances of {@code java.util.Formatter}, and those do
253     *      not know about our special exceptions.
254     *
255     *  @throws NullPointerException    The {@code formatter} argument is
256     *      {@code null}.
257     *
258     *  @see java.util.Formatter
259     *  @see java.util.Formattable#formatTo(java.util.Formatter, int, int, int)
260     */
261    @SuppressWarnings( "ProhibitedExceptionThrown" )
262    @Override
263    public default void formatTo( final Formatter formatter, final int flags, final int width, final int precision )
264    {
265        if( isNull( formatter ) ) throw new NullPointerException( "formatter is null" );
266
267        var s = toString( width, precision );
268
269        if( ((flags & LEFT_JUSTIFY) == LEFT_JUSTIFY) && (width > s.trim().length()) )
270        {
271            s = padRight( s.trim(), width );
272        }
273
274        /*
275         * We do not use Formatter.out().append() because we do not know how to
276         * handle the IOException that could be thrown from
277         * Appendable.append(). Using Formatter.format() assumes that Formatter
278         * knows ...
279         */
280        formatter.format( "%s", s );
281    }   //  formatTo()
282
283    /**
284     *  Returns the unit for the value.
285     *
286     *  @return The unit.
287     */
288    public D getUnit();
289
290    /**
291     *  {@inheritDoc}
292     *  <p>The hash code is based on the
293     *  {@linkplain #baseValue() base value}
294     *  and
295     *  {@linkplain #baseUnit() base unit}
296     *  only.</p>
297     */
298    @Override
299    public int hashCode();
300
301    /**
302     *  Multiplies the value by a dimension-less value and returns the result
303     *  without changing this instance.
304     *
305     *  @param  multiplicand The multiplier.
306     *  @return The new value.
307     */
308    public default DimensionedValue<D> multiply( final BigDecimal multiplicand )
309    {
310        final var retValue = newInstance( baseUnit(), baseValue().multiply( requireNonNullArgument( multiplicand, "multiplicand" ) ) );
311        retValue.setUnit( getUnit() );
312
313        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
314        return retValue;
315    }   //  multiply()
316
317    /**
318     *  Multiplies the value by a dimension-less value and returns the result
319     *  without changing this instance.
320     *
321     *  @param  multiplicand The multiplier.
322     *  @return The new value.
323     */
324    public default DimensionedValue<D> multiply( final Number multiplicand )
325    {
326        final var retValue = multiply( new BigDecimal( requireNonNullArgument( multiplicand, "multiplicand" ).toString() ) );
327        retValue.setUnit( getUnit() );
328
329        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
330        return retValue;
331    }   //  multiply()
332
333    /**
334     *  Multiplies the value by a dimension-less value and returns the result
335     *  without changing this instance.
336     *
337     *  @param  multiplicand The multiplier; it must be possible to parse the
338     *      given String into a
339     *      {@link BigDecimal}.
340     *  @return The new value.
341     *  @throws NumberFormatException   The provided value cannot be converted
342     *      into a {@code BigDecimal}.
343     *
344     *  @see BigDecimal#BigDecimal(String)
345     */
346    public default DimensionedValue<D> multiply( final String multiplicand )
347    {
348        final var retValue = multiply( new BigDecimal( requireNonNullArgument( multiplicand, "multiplicand" ) ) );
349
350        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
351        return retValue;
352    }   //  multiply()
353
354    /**
355     *  Creates an instance for the class.
356     *
357     *  @param  dimension   The dimension for the new instance.
358     *  @param  value   The value for the new instance.
359     *  @return The new instance.
360     */
361    public default DimensionedValue<D> newInstance( final D dimension, final BigDecimal value )
362    {
363        DimensionedValue<D> retValue = null;
364
365        try
366        {
367            //---* Let's get the constructor *---------------------------------
368            final Constructor<DimensionedValue<D>> constructor;
369            if( requireNonNullArgument( dimension, "dimension" ) instanceof Enum<?> enumConstant )
370            {
371                final var enumClass = enumConstant.getDeclaringClass();
372                //noinspection unchecked
373                constructor = (Constructor<DimensionedValue<D>>) getClass().getConstructor( enumClass, BigDecimal.class );
374            }
375            else
376            {
377                throw new IllegalArgumentException( format( "Invalid type for 'dimension': %s", dimension.getClass().getName() ) );
378            }
379
380            //---* Create the new value *----------------------------------
381            retValue = constructor.newInstance( dimension, requireNonNullArgument( value, "value" ) );
382        }
383        catch( final NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException | InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException e )
384        {
385            throw new UnexpectedExceptionError( e );
386        }
387
388        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
389        return retValue;
390    }   //  newInstance()
391
392    /**
393     *  Applies another unit for the value. This does not affect the results
394     *  of
395     *  {@link #equals(Object)},
396     *  {@link #hashCode()}}
397     *  and
398     *  {@link #compareTo(DimensionedValue)},
399     *  nor that of
400     *  {@link #baseValue()}.
401     *
402     *  @param  unit    The new unit.
403     */
404    public void setUnit( D unit );
405
406    /**
407     *  Creates a new instance with the sum of this and the given value, and
408     *  returns that.
409     *
410     *  @param  unit    The unit for the new instance.
411     *  @param  summand The value to add.
412     *  @return The instance with the sum.
413     */
414    public default DimensionedValue<D> sum( final D unit, final DimensionedValue<D> summand )
415    {
416        final var retValue = sum( summand );
417        retValue.setUnit( unit );
418
419        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
420        return retValue;
421    }   //  sum()
422
423    /**
424     *  Creates a new instance with the sum of this and the given value, and
425     *  returns that. The unit for the new instance is that of this instance.
426     *
427     *  @param  summand The value to add.
428     *  @return The instance with the sum.
429     */
430    public default DimensionedValue<D> sum( final DimensionedValue<D> summand )
431    {
432        final var newValue = baseValue().add( requireNonNullArgument( summand, "summand" ).baseValue(), MATH_CONTEXT );
433        final var retValue = newInstance( baseUnit(), newValue );
434
435        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
436        return retValue;
437    }   // sum()
438
439    /**
440     *  <p>{@summary Returns the String representation for this value};
441     *  usually, this is in the format</p>
442     *  <pre><code>&lt;<i>numerical value</i>&gt;&nbsp;&lt;<i>unit symbol</i>&gt;</code></pre>
443     *  <p>like &quot;{@code 4.5 m}&quot;.</p>
444     *  <p>The precision for the mantissa is
445     *  provided by the
446     *  {@linkplain Dimension#getPrecision() unit}.</p>
447     *  <p>If more control over the output format is required, see
448     *  {@link #toString(int, int)}.</p>
449     */
450    @Override
451    public String toString();
452
453    /**
454     *  <p>{@summary Provides a String representation of this value}, in the
455     *  format</p>
456     *  <pre><code>&lt;<i>numerical value</i>&gt;&nbsp;&lt;<i>unit symbol</i>&gt;</code></pre>
457     *  <p>for the given
458     *  {@link Locale}
459     *  that determines the decimal separator, like &quot;{@code 4.5 m}&quot;
460     *  vs. &quot;{@code 4,5 m}&quot;.</p>
461     *  <p>The precision is applied to the numerical part only. The width
462     *  includes the
463     *  {@linkplain Dimension#unitSymbol() unit symbol}, too.</p>
464     *
465     *  @param  locale  The locale to use.
466     *  @param  width   The minimum number of characters to be written to the
467     *      output. If the length of the converted value is less than the width
468     *      then the output will be padded by '&nbsp;' until the total number
469     *      of characters equals width. The padding is at the beginning, as
470     *      numerical values are usually right justified. If {@code width} is
471     *      -1 then there is no minimum.
472     *  @param  precision – The number of digits for the mantissa of the value.
473     *      If {@code precision} is -1 then there is no explicit limit on the
474     *      size of the mantissa.
475     *  @return The String representation for this value.
476     */
477    public default String toString( final Locale locale, final int width, final int precision )
478    {
479        final var retValue = toString( locale, width, precision, false );
480
481        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
482        return retValue;
483    }   //  toString()
484
485    /**
486     *  <p>{@summary Provides a String representation of this value}, in the
487     *  format</p>
488     *  <pre><code>&lt;<i>numerical value</i>&gt;&nbsp;&lt;<i>unit symbol</i>&gt;</code></pre>
489     *  <p>for the given
490     *  {@link Locale}
491     *  that determines the decimal separator, like &quot;{@code 4.5 m}&quot;
492     *  vs. &quot;{@code 4,5 m}&quot;.</p>
493     *  <p>The precision is applied to the numerical part only. The width
494     *  includes the
495     *  {@linkplain Dimension#unitSymbol() unit symbol}, too.</p>
496     *
497     *  @param  locale  The locale to use.
498     *  @param  width   The minimum number of characters to be written to the
499     *      output. If the length of the converted value is less than the width
500     *      then the output will be padded by '&nbsp;' until the total number
501     *      of characters equals width. The padding is at the beginning, as
502     *      numerical values are usually right justified. If {@code width} is
503     *      -1 then there is no minimum.
504     *  @param  precision – The number of digits for the mantissa of the value.
505     *      If {@code precision} is -1 then there is no explicit limit on the
506     *      size of the mantissa.
507     *  @param  useNiceUnit {@code true} if the method
508     *      {@link Dimension#unitSymbolForPrinting() unitSymbolForPrinting()}
509     *      should be used to retrieve the unit symbol, {@code false} if the
510     *      usual one is sufficient.
511     *  @return The String representation for this value.
512     */
513    public default String toString( final Locale locale, final int width, final int precision, final boolean useNiceUnit )
514    {
515        final var unitSymbol = useNiceUnit ? getUnit().unitSymbolForPrinting() : getUnit().unitSymbol();
516        final var effectiveWidth = width - unitSymbol.length() - 1;
517
518        final var format = new StringBuilder( "%" );
519        if( effectiveWidth > 0 ) format.append( effectiveWidth );
520        if( precision >= 0 ) format.append( "." ).append( precision );
521        format.append( "f %s" );
522
523        final var retValue = format( requireNonNullArgument( locale, "locale" ), format.toString(), value(), unitSymbol );
524
525        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
526        return retValue;
527    }   //  toString()
528
529    /**
530     *  <p>{@summary Provides a String representation of this value}, in the
531     *  format</p>
532     *  <pre><code>&lt;<i>numerical value</i>&gt;&nbsp;&lt;<i>unit symbol</i>&gt;</code></pre>
533     *  <p>and for the
534     *  {@linkplain Locale#getDefault() default Locale},
535     *  like &quot;{@code 4.5 m}&quot;, where the Locale determines the decimal
536     *  separator.</p>
537     *  <p>The precision is applied to the numerical part only. The width
538     *  includes the
539     *  {@linkplain Dimension#unitSymbol() unit symbol}, too.</p>
540     *
541     *  @param  width   The minimum number of characters to be written to the
542     *      output. If the length of the converted value is less than the width
543     *      then the output will be padded by '&nbsp;' until the total number
544     *      of characters equals width. The padding is at the beginning, as
545     *      numerical values are usually right justified. If {@code width} is
546     *      -1 then there is no minimum.
547     *  @param  precision – The number of digits for the mantissa of the value.
548     *      If {@code precision} is -1 then there is no explicit limit on the
549     *      size of the mantissa.
550     *  @return The String representation for this value.
551     */
552    public default String toString( final int width, final int precision )
553    {
554        final var retValue = toString( Locale.getDefault(), width, precision );
555
556        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
557        return retValue;
558    }   //  toString()
559
560    /**
561     *  <p>{@summary Provides a String representation of this value}, in the
562     *  format that is defined by the provided format String.</p>
563     *  <p>That format String must contain exactly one '%f' tag and one '%s'
564     *  tag; the first takes the numerical value, the second the unit.</p>
565     *  <p>The provided
566     *  {@link Locale}
567     *  determines the decimal separator and the optional thousands
568     *  separator.</p>
569     *
570     *  @param  locale  The locale to use.
571     *  @param  format  The format String.
572     *  @param  useNiceUnit {@code true} if the method
573     *      {@link Dimension#unitSymbolForPrinting() unitSymbolForPrinting()}
574     *      should be used to retrieve the unit symbol, {@code false} if the
575     *      usual one is sufficient.
576     *  @return The String representation for this value.
577     *  @throws IllegalFormatException  The provided format String is invalid.
578     *
579     *  @see java.util.Formatter
580     */
581    public default String toString( final Locale locale, final String format, final boolean useNiceUnit ) throws IllegalFormatException
582    {
583        final var unitSymbol = useNiceUnit ? getUnit().unitSymbolForPrinting() : getUnit().unitSymbol();
584        final var retValue = format( requireNonNullArgument( locale, "locale" ), requireNotEmptyArgument( format, "format" ), value(), unitSymbol );
585
586        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
587        return retValue;
588    }   //  toString()
589
590    /**
591     *  <p>{@summary Validates the given value, based on the type of the
592     *  dimension.}</p>
593     *  <p>This method will be called by the constructors always with the
594     *  {@linkplain #baseUnit() base unit}
595     *  value just before the value will be initialised.</p>
596     *  <p>This default implementation will do nothing.</p>
597     *
598     *  @param  value   The value in base units.
599     *  @return The value.
600     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    The validation failed.
601     */
602    @MountPoint
603    public default BigDecimal validate( final BigDecimal value ) throws IllegalArgumentException
604    {
605        return value;
606    }   //  validate()
607    /**
608     *  Returns the numerical value.
609     *
610     *  @return The numerical value, based on current dimension.
611     */
612    public default BigDecimal value() { return convert( getUnit() ); }
613}
614//  interface DimensionedValue
615
616/*
617 *  End of File
618 */
